page.title: 04FINE JANE'S PUMPING STATION.
page.content: The manned water pumping station known as Fine Jane's Pumping station was built in 1924. There are three large pumps that can be operated manually or automatically. An electrode circuit controls the automatic system. The water balance must rise to trigger the shorter of the electrodes which starts the pumping automatically. These pumps work on a continuous network, handling 70,000 gallons of water per minute, passing this water through a series of sluices to an unmanned station and from there onto the Altcar flood gates and the sea. The drainage ditches and the pumping station are vital to this land, as without them farming would be impossible except for a few short months in the summer. Since they were installed farming is carried out all year.
